Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Qualitative \Qual"i*ta*tive\, a. [Cf. LL. gualitativus, F. qualitatif.] Relating to quality; having the character of quality. -- {Qual"i*ta*tive*ly}, adv. [1913 Webster]
{Qualitative analysis} (Chem.), analysis which merely determines the constituents of a substance without any regard to the quantity of each ingredient; -- contrasted with quantitative analysis. [1913 Webster]
qualitatively adv : in a qualitative manner; "this discoloration qualitatively suggests that the substance is low in inorganic iron"
